meanings.definition: A person who speaks or cries out loudly.
meanings.sent1: The vociferator in the park was shouting about the lost dog.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the vociferator to lower their voice during class.
meanings.sent3: The vociferator at the concert was louder than the music!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a vociferator.
meanings.sent5: The vociferator's voice boomed across the field, startling the birds.

meanings.definition: To speak or cry out loudly.
meanings.sent1: The protestors vociferated their demands outside the government building.
meanings.sent2: The baby vociferated in the middle of the night, waking up the whole household.
meanings.sent3: The parrot vociferated so much that it learned to mimic the sound of the phone ringing!
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm vociferated its fury, shaking the windows with its power.
meanings.sent5: The coach vociferated instructions to the players, urging them to give their best effort.
